qas.question: What year was Blumenbach's treatise published?
How many divisions did Blumenbach's treatise specify?
What race was later renamed to Negroid?
What type of transition was noted from one group to the next?
What can one not mark between the variety of mankind?

context: The <a0_0>1775<a0_0/> treatise "The Natural Varieties of Mankind", by Johann Friedrich Blumenbach proposed <a1_0>five<a1_0/> major divisions: the Caucasoid race, Mongoloid race, <a2_0>Ethiopian<a2_0/> race (later termed Negroid, and not to be confused with the narrower Ethiopid race), American Indian race, and Malayan race, but he did not propose any hierarchy among the races. Blumenbach also noted the <a3_0>graded<a3_0/> transition in appearances from one group to adjacent groups and suggested that "one variety of mankind does so sensibly pass into the other, that you cannot mark out the <a4_0>limits<a4_0/> between them".
